Risk.labeling: If the account is 'PNC Wire In, or Chase Wire In' you should label that BT as Risk
Risk.reconciliation: If there is a BT that is labeled as Risk, you should wait until 10 am PST to reach out Risk Team. You can use the risk-payments slack channel to reach the Risk Team. There are two teams that record BTs. If the account of the BT is 'recovery' you should reach out collections team through the risk-payments channel. If the account of the BT is Payroll/wireins you should reach out to the credit ops team through the risk-payments channel. (Recovery) —> Risk Channel —> collections (Payroll/wireins) —> Risk Channel —> credit ops You should link BT, company, and payroll to your message.
Risk.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

additional_sops.title: Escalating Reconciliation Issues to Cross-Functional Stakeholders

Recovery Wire.labeling: If the account is 'Chase Recovery' you should label that BT as Recovery Wire
Recovery Wire.reconciliation: If there is a BT that is labeled as Risk, you should wait until 10 am PST to reach out Risk Team. You can use the risk-payments slack channel to reach the Risk Team. There are two teams that record BTs. If the account of the BT is 'recovery' you should reach out collections team through the risk-payments channel. (Recovery) —> Risk Channel —> collections
Recovery Wire.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

additional_sops.title: Escalating Reconciliation Issues to Cross-Functional Stakeholders

Check.labeling: When you see check paid as the BT's payment method, you should label that BT as Check
Check.reconciliation: First, check the suggestions in the reconciliation queue. If you cannot locate the check in suggestions, go to the banking portal and review the check image to verify the details before reconciling.
Check.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

additional_sops.title: Double Cashed Checks
additional_sops.note: ⚠️ ONLY for double-cashed check scenarios - this is a critical issue

NY WH.labeling: When you see NYS DTF WT on BT's description you should label that BT as NY WH
NY WH.reconciliation: If there is a BT that the agent is NY WTH, you will see some suggested transmissions. You should reconcile it with the oldest transmission since NY WTH BTs don't give us any identifying information
NY WH.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

OH WH.labeling: When you see OH WH TAX on BT's description you should label that BT as OH WH
OH WH.reconciliation: If there is a BT that the agent is OH WH, you will see an IN ID NO in the description. This description contains zeros at the beginning. You should copy the ID number without the zeros and paste that number to the OH WTH section in the reconciliation cleanup dashboard (redash). Then, you will have the electronic payment ID. You should enter this ID as the transmission ID and select the electronic payment as the transmission type.
OH WH.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

CSC.labeling: When you see CSCXXXXXX on BT's description you should label that BT as CSC
CSC.reconciliation: If there is a BT that the agent is CSC, you will see some suggested transmissions. The description of the transmission (CSC 123456) should match with the description in the transaction (DESC=CSC123456). If they match, you should also check the origination account and the amount.
CSC.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

LOI.labeling: When you see Remark: ACH RETURN SETTLEMENT on BT's description you should label that BT as LOI. If the description includes 'CREDIT MEMO', the BT should be labeled as 'LOI'.
LOI.reconciliation: Locate the customer reference number on the bank transaction. This field will tell you what JPA investigation ID this return is associated with. The field is limited to 10 characters - the first 6 digits is the date and you'll need to put leading zeros to make the last 6. Plug in the JPA Investigation ID into your search box in your email to locate the case. Locate the earliest email from CB Fraud Support with this investigation ID to see the original payment(s) the LOI was for. Open the attachment titled 'Agreement and Schedule for Case [XXXXXXX]' and scroll to Schedule 1 section to locate the payments. Use the individual ID(s) that starts with '6sem...' code to look up the nachas and reconcile.
LOI.sop_page: Letter of Indemnity Process and Reconciliation

Lockbox.labeling: When you see Lockbox on the BT's description you should label that BT as Lockbox
Lockbox.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

OH SDWH.labeling: When you see OH SDWH on BT's description you should label that BT as OH SDWH
OH SDWH.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

ICP Funding.labeling: When you see Chase International Contractor Payment as the account and 'TRANSFER FROM ACCOUNT000000807737908' in the description, you should label that BT as ICP Funding. In total, there will be 2 BTs to be labeled as ICP Funding and both of them will have 'REMARK=JPMORGAN ACCESS TRANSFER' on their description. When you see 'REMARK=JPMORGAN ACCESS TRANSFER' on BT's description label that BT as ICP Funding. There will be two ICP funding BTs, one from Chase ICP account and one from Chase Ops.
ICP Funding.reconciliation: ICP Funding is handled like Treasury Transfer. Use the EP creator tool under the Custom Reporting flow. Use Unintended Overpayment Account as the Payment Account type and use the ZenPayroll ID as the company ID. Note which direction the transaction is for (debit/credit) and select the correct direction type for Transaction type. First, you should search the amount in your mail. If no relative email exists you should search for electronic payment. You start to reconcile with wire out. If the electronic payment with the same amount does not exist, you should use the Electronic Payment Creator Tool.
ICP Funding.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

additional_sops.title: Unintended Overpayment Account Use Cases
additional_sops.note: ⭐ ICP Funding is handled like Treasury Transfer - use this SOP

additional_sops.title: Escalating Reconciliation Issues to Cross-Functional Stakeholders
Reconciling DLocal Transactions Manually
additional_sops.note: For DLocal transactions - ONLY if description contains 'DLOCAL'

NY UI.labeling: When you see NYS DOL UI on BT's description you should label that BT as NY UI
NY UI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

Bad Debt.labeling: When you see various transmissions with an amount less than $1.00 you should label them as Bad Debt (For Example: $0.01, $0.02, $0.03…)
Bad Debt.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

ICP Return.labeling: When you see Chase International Contractor Payment as the account and 'ach external' as the method you should label that BT as ICP Return
ICP Return.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

ICP.labeling: When you see 'ORIG CO NAME=DLOCAL' (sometimes it might be DLOCL) on BT's description label that BT as ICP
ICP.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

NM UI.labeling: When you see STATE OF NM DWS ENTRY DESCR: UI PAYMENT on BT's description you should label that BT as NM UI
NM UI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

WA ESD.labeling: If the account is Chase Operations and the description contains STATE OF WA ESD you should label that BT as WA ESD. If the account is PNC Operations and the description contains ESD WA UI-TAX you should label that BT as WA ESD
WA ESD.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

IL UI.labeling: When you see IL DEPT EMPL SEC on BT's description you should label that BT as IL UI
IL UI.reconciliation: If there is a BT that is labeled as IL UI you should find the company name in the description. You should write this company name to Reconciliation Clean Up on redash. (https://redash.zp-int.com/dashboard/reconciliation-cleanup) You can find the agent payment link and electronic payment id. You should reconcile with the electronic payment ip.
IL UI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

MT UI.labeling: When you see MT TAX or STATE OF MONTANA on BT's description you should label that BT as MT UI
MT UI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

York Adams Tax.labeling: When you see YORK ADAMS TAX on BT's description you should label that BT as York Adams Tax
York Adams Tax.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

WA LNI.labeling: When you see L&I or Labor&Industries on BT's description you should label that BT as WA LNI
WA LNI.reconciliation: WA LNI : It could be checked by the Reconciliation Cleanup board
WA LNI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

Berks Tax.labeling: When you see Berks EIT on BT's description you should label that BT as Berks Tax
Berks Tax.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

Money Market Fund.labeling: When you see MONEY MKT MUTUAL FUND on BT's description you should label that BT as Money Market Fund
Money Market Fund.reconciliation: Use the EP creator tool under the Custom Reporting flow. Use Unintended Overpayment Account as the Payment Account type and use the ZenPayroll ID as the company ID. Select the appropriate Transaction Type under Payment Record Information based on whether the transaction is debit or credit.

Blueridge Interest.labeling: When you see Accrued Int. on BT's description and its bank is Blueridge, you should label that BT as Blueridge Interest
Blueridge Interest.reconciliation: Use the EP creator tool under the Custom Reporting flow. Use Unintended Overpayment Account as the Payment Account type and use the ZenPayroll ID as the company ID. Select Interest Income as both the Transaction Type and Transaction Category under Payment Record Information. You will not need to fill out the Optional Payment Record field.

ACH Reversal.labeling: When you see ACH CREDIT SETTLEMENT on BT's description, you should label that BT as ACH Reversal
ACH Reversal.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

ACH.labeling: When you see REMARK=EFT REVERSAL on BT's description, you should label that BT as ACH
ACH.reconciliation: If there is a BT that is labeled as ACH you should reconcile with the recommended transmission including the same description. An example for CON12345, the description of the BT is DESC:CON750119. You can find the same description in the suggested BTs' description.
ACH.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

Interest Adjustment.labeling: When you see REMARK=INTEREST ADJUSTMENT on BT's description, you should label that BT as Interest Adjustment
Interest Adjustment.reconciliation: Use the EP creator tool under the Custom Reporting flow. Use Unintended Overpayment Account as the Payment Account type and use the ZenPayroll ID as the company ID. Select Interest Income as both the Transaction Type and Transaction Category under Payment Record Information. You will not need to fill out the Optional Payment Record field.

ACH Return.labeling: When you see RTN OFFSET on BT's description, you should label that BT as ACH Return
ACH Return.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

VA UI.labeling: When you see VA. EMPLOY COMM on BT's description, you should label that BT as VA UI
VA UI.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile

Treasury Transfer.labeling: When you see US TREASURY CAPITAL on BT's description, you should label that BT as Treasury Transfer
Treasury Transfer.reconciliation: If you see any transfers created from Treasury team that relate to funds being swept out of corporate account, use the EP creator tool under the Custom Reporting flow. Use Unintended Overpayment Account as the Payment Account type and use the ZenPayroll ID as the company ID. Note which direction the transaction is for (debit/credit) and select the correct direction type for Transaction type (Debit/Credit treasury funding).

Brex.labeling: When you see Brex in transaction description
Brex.reconciliation: If there is a BT that is labeled as Brex and the payment direction is credit, you should find the relevant EP and reconcile with it. If the payment direction is debit you should escalate this BT to the payment-ops-recon Slack channel.
Brex.sop_page: Daily Operations : How to Label & Reconcile
